fields.description:
My old configuration was confluence 2.5.4 ear/war with german language pack (loaded from your site, see attachment) installed.

I just upgraded to 2.6.0 using your upgrade documentation, without copying the language pack (2.6.0 has the german translation included). From now on it's impossible to change the default language to english, the displayed language still stays in german. Same with changing the user prefered language to english.On the other side, switching to french works.

I also tried the following
* I restarted the web container (tomcat)
* I deactivated the german language plugin
without any visible results.

The only way to get back to english is removing  the {{$CONFLUENCE_HOME/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-de_DE-plugin-1.1.jar}} file. When I reinstalled this file, I get the same behaviour as described above.
fields.summary: Cannot switch to english language after upgrading to 2.6.0 from 2.5.4 with german language pack

fields.description: ... so it's not possible to revert plugin-selection related changes made in online mode in offline mode (such as "show all plugins" vs "show only plugins likely to work").
fields.summary: Plugin repository's Admin tab not available in offline mode...
Selecting a template creates inconsistent behaviour of the "New Page" being greyed out

fields.description: Version 2.6 of Confluence makes the Insert/Modify Table popup full screen width, which is really annoying. I've confirmed this on IE7 and Firefox 2. In particular when you're using two monitors it spans over both and is really annoying. The < 2.5 popup size was fine.
fields.summary: Insert/Modify Table popup in rich text editor is too wide
Unescaped wiki markup in excerpts in "Recently Updated" on dashboard, comment summaries
Add "(Optional)" beside the comment for all attachment fields

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create 2 pages, one with a broken link.
2. Make the first page use the {include} macro to include the second page.
3. Click the broken link from the first page.

Now the new page will be created with the default location of a child of the *included* page, not the current page.
fields.summary: Broken link hyperlink creates new page as a child of the included page

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Edit a page and change the title and save the page.
2. Go to the Page Info tab and click the date of the previous version.
3. Note that the correct page title WILL be displayed on the previous version display.
4. Click "Restore this version" and the content will be restored but not the page title.
fields.summary: Restoring a page version doesn't restore the title

fields.description: This may be intentional but it's very confusing - can you delete pages from the history (i.e. History link AND the History tab when using the rich text "Link" button) when the page is deleted?
fields.summary: Deleted pages still appear in browsing history

fields.description:
When you perform a task like importing a space you get a list of breadcrumbs as follows:

Dashboard > Running task > Importing data

When you click "Running task" though, the Confluence admin menu items are shown but the breadcrumb is changed to:

Running task > Importing data

Should the Dashboard be listed in there? As soon as you click on any of the admin menu items it's shown again like normal.
fields.summary: Breadcrumb on "Running Tasks" doesn't list the Dashboard

fields.description: Currently Confluence is pretty clever - if you edit a page and try to restrict the "View" permission to someone else only, it will add you to the list of users with the "View" permission. Even if you go back and edit the page to remove yourself from the users with "View" permission, it'll add you again. I think there's a bug with the Page Info tab functionality though, because you can click the padlock icon to remove the "View" permission from yourself in this case. Or maybe that's intentional? As a result the page doesn't appear in the "Pages" tab in Browse Space, but I can get to it directly (as an admin). This could create problems if I tried to create another page with the same name, it would be very confusing! Can you also check if the padlock functionality is broken in "Restricted Pages" in Space Admin too?
fields.summary: Users can prevent themselves from viewing a page using restrictions

fields.description: Some people are confused by the "Comment" field, which is assumed to be a general comment on the page. Since the functionality is really related to the specific page revision only, can this field be renamed to "Revision Comment"?
fields.summary: Rename "Comment" on page editing to "Revision Comment"
Require a mechanism to change the version comments on a page
Notation guide in rich text editor

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create 2 spaces.
2. Edit the "Home" page of one space.
3. Change the title, and at the same time change the location to "Home" of another space.
4. When you click save, the error "A page can not be set as its own parent." is thrown.

Is it possible that the programmatic order of the move operation is trying to move the page before renaming?
fields.summary: "A page can not be set as its own parent." error trying to rename and move a page

fields.description:
... because of missing TD tags in global Preferences layout The global layout in Confluence 2.6.0 is missing a tag in Preferences, causing the border underneath the tabs not to be rendered. To fix this, need to add the following tags in the default global layout: #elseif ($context == "profile") #set ($readOnly = $helper.action.user && $userAccessor.isReadOnly($helper.action.user))
  • #foreach ($item in $action.webInterfaceManager.getDisplayableItems("system.profile", $action.remoteUser, $helper)) $item.label.getDisplayableLabel($req, $helper) #end
  • #if ($action.space) #personalSpaceLink() #else #createPersonalSpaceLink() #end
fields.summary: Border underneath the main page tabs is not rendered on IE

fields.description:
The thumbnail macro renders transparent backgrounds as black, for GIF images.

PNGs are fine, and JPG doesn't support transparency anyway, so GIF is the only affected format.
A quick-and-dirty interim workaround would be to change the default to a white background, as that would reduce the impact of the issue.
fields.summary: Thumbnail macro doesn't support transparency in GIF and PNG images
Log classpath diagnostics on startup
Document location of plugin source code for all shipped plugins

fields.description:
I've been doing some work storing our build information in Confluence using the remote API.  I update a row in a table indicating build information.  Users can subscribe to get page updates.  The Confluence email functionality currently indicates the revision comment at the top of the email.  That's great and I want to exploit that functionality.   When I store a page I want the option to supply a revision comment.

Please note that I'm not asking about adding a comment to a page.  I know that functionality already exists.  This request is for adding a comment to the revision of the page being stored.  These are the comments that are visible when you take a look at the change history of a page.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please modify remote API to add comment as an attribute of Page

fields.description:
The space export work done for 2.6 turns out to have had some design flaws. Fixing these issues is too large to do in the scope of a bug fix release and therefore the bug fix team are targeting it at the next Confluence release.
In the mean time, a small work around will be made in the stable branch to solve the problem in the easiest possible way (see CONF-9659 for example).

This defect is the new placeholder for the space export rework, and the existing defects will be resolved by a bug fix release.
fields.summary: Rework the Space Export functionality - broken by 2.6 changes.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Edit a wiki page
# Edit Restrictions
# Click on "Choose users"
# Select the "Group memberships" option and enter a name of a group
# Try to use the pagination

Current behavior:
* only the first page is displayed, clicking on any of the pagination links refreshes the page again with the first page

Expected behavior:
* first page is displayed, a user can see second, third, etc page by using the pagination controls

Note: the pagination works fine if the "User Details" option is used to search for users instead.

fields.description:
The rich text editor has "Indent" and "Outdent" icons - when you use them the preview reflects the change, but when you submit the change nothing is applied to the resulting page.

I also didn't find any documentation of a wiki markup for indentation, so either this is not supported by confluence and the icons should be removed from the richtext editor, or the markup is not documented and the editor is broken.

We would prefer if Confluence supported this feature, as indentation can be handy in certain situations.
fields.summary: Indentation doesn't work in the rich text editor

fields.description: I am running the migration from file-system to database storage of attachments (so I can run Massive). In my trial run, I have 13 GB of attachments. It seems that it is not committing the files to the database until all are copied there, which is filling up our temp tablespace on our testing db. (our temp space was 8GB). My question is, am I correct in saying that confluence will import all files then commit, or does it commit after each file or group of files? This could be a big deal when I import our production data if it is all at one bang. (i.e. What would happen if we had 1TB of attachments?)
fields.summary: Attachment migration from filesystem to database or vice versa cannot move large numbers of attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9884].
  {panel}

A plugin macro that creates drop-down/combo boxes on a Confluence page, whose values are supplied by a list-generating source.

The ideal syntax would be like  {{\{dropdown source=<something that generates a list>\}}}. On saving the page, a user could select a value from the combo box, and have the markup turn into something like {{\{dropdown value="current value" source=<something that generates a list>\}}}, with "current value" appearing as the new default value in the combo box.
If it can be made that generic, then anything that generates a list (SQL queries, literal lists, metadata queries) could be used as a data source.

This would enable data-entry with referential integrity enforced by a central data store.
fields.summary: Plugin to create drop-down boxes which can be populated by values taken from a list
Use SWFUpload for enhanced file upload controls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9872].
  {panel}

/confluence/WEB-INF/classes doesn't look the same in 2.6! All those config files, they're here now:
/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-2.6.0.jar

Here are the files that need configuration:
* /database-dafaults/mssql.properties, for [connecting to MSSQL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+For+SQL+Server]
* confluence-coherence-cache-config.xml, for [configuring the cache|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Performance+Tuning]
* schedulingSubsystemContext.xml, for configuring chron-like jobs for [backups|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Changing+time+of+Daily+Backup] & indexing

I've changed the actual text of these 3 docs.

The enhancement request is:
# replace those three files (and perhaps others I might have missed?) back in the /WEB-INF/classes directory so they are easily configurable. 
# Return the documentation for the 3 pages to refer to the proper location of the files.
fields.summary: Confluguration xml files should be stored in /WEB-INF/classes, not in /lib/confluence-2.6.0.jar

fields.description:
Symptoms: the list of "Recently Updated" items stops being automatically updated 
This seems to be caused by a reindexing problem
Detailed explanations: attached powerpoint 
Solution: the only solution at this point is to reset the server (not only the service)  - this is painful and needs to get solved.

I have found 2 related points:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6857
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6985

But we don't have the scripting macro.

fields.description:
The resulting problem is very similiar to CONF-9612; however it does not appear to be related to themes in this case.

Basically we see an error when we click on the "Edit Calendary Settings" icon, however we've also noticed that any time a page has a calendar on it, the wheel spins continuously on the calendar, sort of like it never loads.

ass java.util.MissingResourceException : Can't find resource for bundle java.util.PropertyResourceBundle, key title.settings

fields.description: Content indexing stops working, moves/adds/changes are no more shown in the Recently Updated list, notifications are not sent out. Triggering a manual rebuild of the index solves the problem for a short time, but then it reoccurs.
fields.summary: Content Indexing Stops

fields.description:
If you manually alter the space permissions url in an attempt to update a difference space, and put in an invalid space key, the action will apply the permissions as global permissions.

This is because global permissions are stored against the NULL space key which is used when the space can not be found.

Need to detect the invalid space key and show an appropriate error message instead of continuing.
fields.summary: Entering invalid space key in URL allows setting of invalid global permissions
Have "Insanely Good Email Integration"

fields.description:
We need to be able to display information like database connection pool size (and number of used connections), general database availability, mailserver-availability, database latency, and so on.

We should have this information in the system information page (and provide some explanations) but also provide a JMX interface for easy monitoring.

The documentation for this feature can be found at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Live+Monitoring+Using+the+JMX+Interface
fields.summary: Provide JMX interface for Confluence core statistics

fields.description:
When trying to add a group, the UI returns a message "Invalid user or group name(s)" after trying to add the group to a page restriction. This happens when the group has a trailing space character. This happens even if the group is selected from the group picker or entered manually with a trailing space.

You can see the trailing space by looking at the string in the groups table on the database, or by noticing the + sign in the URL when viewing group members from the group browser, as in: 
<baseURL>/admin/users/domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=FDSI_Audit+

The same problem does not apply to users, at least not users created through Confluence. It appears that trailing spaces are removed when users are created.
fields.summary: Page restrictions cannot handle group with space character at the end of the string

fields.description:
The 'next' and 'previous' links do not work correctly on the alphabetical page list when no 'startsWith' letter is selected.

If you are viewing the list of all pages in the space and click the 'next' link it displays the next 30 beginning with 'A' rather than any starting letter, the 'previous' link will then show that Confluence is doing 'startsWith=a' instead of 'startsWith='.

I suspect that this bug probably stems from the CONF-8952 fix that defaults 'startsWith' to a if it's not a letter.
fields.summary: Browse Space - Pages pagination broken
PersonalInformation (userinfo) fetching assumes a uniqueness constraint that isn't enforced

fields.description:
When using various macros or formatting to control the Left Nav with the custom Navigation file - content doesn't show formatted the same as it formats in the page.

One particularly difficult reformatting issue is using the {pagetree} macro.  I've attached two images, using the same macro.  One image shows that the macro correctly displays a tree view with list items NEXT TO the plus/Minus and page icons.  The other image shows that in the left hand nav, the items are wrapped and unpredictably shown in a highlighted version.  

I know that a work around to have an expand/collapse menu on the left hand nav is to use javascript and id's on relevant pages, but this requires a lot more work on the part of our users.

In summary, it would be great if the Left Hand Nav looked just like the page view.
fields.summary: Macros used in custom Navigation file for Left Nav don't render the same as they do in the page

fields.description:
The macro should allow the user to choose which columns to display and not limit the column to a given set. Every column, custom included, should be available to me macro.

Also, an order parameter should be added to allow ordering the results.
fields.summary: jiraissues macro should allow adding more columns and ordering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9847].
  {panel}

Confluence instance which integrated with Crowd, seems to return an inconsistence result when searching users or groups(created via Crowd) using wildcards. 
For example, there is a user called "testuser" being added in the Crowd instance. Doing a search in the Confluence's {{Manage Users}} page with the following input to the username session returns the result as outlined:

|| Search query || Result ||
| \* | Return all users from Crowd and Confluence (including the user, {{testuser}}) |
| test* | Return no result | 
| t* | Return no result |
| testuser* | Return the expected result |

The situation is reproducible when searching for groups which were created in Crowd too. The inconsistency occurred when assigning {{space permission}} to groups.
fields.summary: Inconsistent wildcard searches for users or groups when integrated with Crowd

fields.description:
This bug is only really a problem in that it can confuse people.  Nodes in a Confluence cluster are successfully bound together by using a common multicast address and a blank cluster name specified in the coherence configuration.

Confluence is specifying a "cluster-name" element within the "cluster-config" element passed to Coherence.  The "cluster-name" element should be within the "member-identity" element within the "cluster-config".   See also [http://wiki.tangosol.com/display/COH32UG/member-identity]

(The warning is displayed in the logs.)
fields.summary: Tangosol configuration: the (optional) cluster-name element is in the wrong place
Support for multiple decorators for the pattern in decorator plugin module

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9844].
  {panel}

Currently, the default theme used in Confluence 2.6.0 rendered the Dashboard's "Spaces" session with a new layout. However, changing the global theme to use "Classic Theme" instead do not possess the exact "Spaces" session as achieved in the Confluence pre 2.6.0. It appears that there is no horizontal lines to separate each of the spaces and the {{spaceKEY}} does not exists anymore. Please review the following images for the illustration of the Dashboard's "spaces" session in both Confluence 2.6 and Confluence 2.5.6:

- DefaultTheme2.6.jpg = The expected spaces list when using the default theme in Confluence 2.6
- OldDefaultTheme.jpg = The expected spaces list when using the default theme in Confluence 2.5.6
- ClassicTheme2.6.jpg = The spaces list seems to be different from the one used in Confluence 2.5.6 when the Confluence 2.6 is configured to use the "Classic Theme"
fields.summary: The spaces list session in the Dashboard displayed differently when using the "Confluence Classic Theme"
The Warning-, Info-, Tip- and Note-Macros do not expand to full column/screen width

fields.description:
There are two different conditions for what may be the same problem. 

Condition A: Space configured as Default Theme renders tabs as text when Global Theme is switched to Classic.

Steps to replicate (make sure during steps 1 and 2 you don't cause condition B below!):
# Set space theme to Default
# Set Global theme to Default
# Change Global theme to Classic
Browse to a page - the tabs will render incorrectly.

Workaround:
From the error condition, switch the space theme to classic, then back to default.

Condition B: Space configured as Classic Theme renders additional tabs when Global theme is switched to Default
It looks like the inverse of Condition A:
# Set Space to Default
# Set Global to Classic (again, make sure you don't cause condition A when you set this part up)
# Switch Global theme to Default

Workaround: Switch the space theme to Classic and then back to default.
fields.summary: Space theme renders extra tabs or tabs as text when global theme is switched

fields.description: Jira does this very well with an option for the Administrator.  By being within the application, details of one's environment can be sent automatically.  Id Confluence did the same, it could pass back more context and prevent the user having to paste in the environment information.
fields.summary: Allow a support request to be raised within Confluence

fields.description:
This is a usability item with the Rich Text Editor.

Our users create links by clicking on the Insert/Edit Link button, and pasting a URL (usually from another window) into the Link field.  Sometimes they enter an Alias and sometimes not.  Most of the time the URL points to another page in the same Confluence Space, but since they never look at the wiki markup they do not understand the difference between an internal and an external link.  Then later the target page gets renamed, but Confluence does not update the link because it was created as an external link, not an internal link.

The Rich Text Editor should recognize links which start with the Server Base URL and automatically convert them to internal links.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor should convert links to internal if they start with the server base URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9837].
  {panel}

My problem is not a problem with the system as it stands, but a request for the future.  I have created a space for our group and I have found no way to create a drop down list.

Cloaking is great, but the cloaked information underneath can be listed but cannot be arranged in any way.  It cannot be bolded, colored, highlighted, etc.  Neither can it be bulleted which would be a great improvement.

As for now, cloaking is the only way I have found to do drop down lists, but when adding informational links below, it begins to get jumbled together. 

I have also tried using decks with cards in order to try to make the page more manageable.  However, if this is to work, I need to have a running list of cards going across the screen.  This is easily done.  I am not able to make the tabs of the cards into links if I need to, is there a way to do this that I am just not seeing?


ok, to summarize. 
1) Is there a way to do a drop down list?
2) Is there a way to somehow set apart the cloaked information once it is uncloaked?
3) When using decks of cards, is there a way to take the tab of the card and make that tab a link (and yes I know, it would take away the card information at the bottom).

Thank you!
fields.summary: Drop Down Box for list
Copy architectural documentation to CAC

fields.description:
When performing a search from the secondary search bar (the one which is available underneath the primary search tab after performing a search), non Latin characters are incorrectly encoded.
This appears to be due to the fact that this search bar uses a GET to perform the query, while the primary search tab uses a POST.

fields.description:
According to the API for the V2 Macro object's 'getBodyRenderMode()' method:

{quote}
If this method returns null, it causes the macro processor to treat the macro as one that returns wiki-text rather than HTML. The body of the macro will be passed in un-rendered, and the macro's output will be inserted back into the page for further normal processing by the wiki-engine.
{quote}

Unfortunately, there seems to be a bug in the {{com.atlassian.confluence.links.LinkParserHelper}} object, where it assumes that the 'getBodyRenderMode()' method will always return an object (line 41):

{code:java}
        if (macro != null && macro.hasBody() && macro.getBodyRenderMode().renderLinks())
{code}

This causes the following exception to be thrown when saving a page containing said macro:

{noformat}
2007-10-26 10:13:38,539 ERROR [http-8080-Processor2] [com.opensymphony.xwork.ActionSupport] doSaveEditPageBean An error occured while storing the requested page!

	at $Proxy19.getPropertySet(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.languages.DefaultLocaleManager.getLocale(DefaultLocaleManager.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport.getLocale(ConfluenceActionSupport.java:546)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport.getI18n(ConfluenceActionSupport.java:600)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceActionSupport.getText(ConfluenceActionSupport.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.AbstractEditPageAction.doSaveEditPageBean(AbstractEditPageAction.java:185)

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat}

Not pretty. A workaround it to return a RenderMode from the 'getBodyRenderMode()' method, however there is no way to have Confluence behave in the same way as returning 'null' is supposed to, which effects how the macros render in the final page.
fields.summary: Macros returning null from getBodyRenderMode() cause page edits to fail

fields.description:
As a wiki admin, I'd like to enforce a policy whereby users can have their own personal space, but it is "private" by default, and the user is not able to change permissions on it. By private, I mean the personal space has full privs for the individual, no groups, and no anonymous.

I need to do this because I provision logical groups of spaces and users for clients, and I need to ensure clients can't see each other's info.
fields.summary: As a wiki admin, enforce private personal spaces
Insert Link dialog should allow selection of user profiles and personal spaces

fields.description:
As a convenience, show the wiki format of a page link at the top of the page (or on the Info tab). For example, the Home page of the ENG space would show this text:  \[ENG:Home\]

Quite often, my users want to create a link to the page that they are reading. Rather than use the create link icon in the page from which they want to create the link, they go to the page to which they want to link and swipe the URL from the browser. Unfortunately, they then create HTTP-style links rather than wiki formatted links. Since these links are not maintained by the wiki, any relocation of link target pages means that the link is not rewritten in the linking pages.
fields.summary: Show wiki-formatted link at top of wiki page

fields.description: When the user presses the ESC key in the wiki editor, all previous edits are removed. Undo key sequence (CTRL-Y) does not restore the text. Please make the ESC key be a no-op in this editor -- it causes problems for my users who are used to using vi.
fields.summary: Pressing escape key in wiki text editor removes all previous edits

fields.description: In edit mode of Rich Text Editor code style text shows with variable width font instead of fixed width font. This makes it difficult to edit. In preview or view mode the text shows correctly in fixed width style.
fields.summary: In edit mode (RTE) code style text shows with variable font instead of fixed font

fields.description:
The "Forgot password" function invents a new password and sends it by email.

This invites to misuse as guessing the userid already allows to annoy or even lock-out the legitimate account owner.  (The user may currently not have access to his email account or the mail could be killed by a spam filter.)

Possible solutions could be that the old password remains valid until changed by the user himself, or a new password is only generated when the user acknowleges having received the email.
fields.summary: "Forgot password" function allows easy misuse

fields.description:
- When adding a link via the toolbars icon, only the internal labels of the text files and buttons appear.
- Whenn adding an image attachment via the toolbars icon, only the internal labels of the text fields and buttons appear (show screenshot)
- The icon "Bild einfuegen" is only visible in editing mode
fields.summary: The german interface has two grave missing translations

fields.summary: Table layout and code macro problems in PDF export

fields.description:
The documentation for changing the time of automatic daily backups needs to be updated due to some changes in Confluence 2.6

Previously users simply have to go to their /confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory and modify the *schedulingSubsystemContext.xml* file. 
The xml file has now been bundled in the *confluence-2.6.0.jar* file located in the {{confluence/WEB-INF/lib/}} directory. 

Users who wish to change the time will need to extract the jar and modify the xml found in the root folder (once unzipped). 
After modifying it, repackage the jar file and copy it back into the WEB-INF/lib directory.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Changing+time+of+Daily+Backup

Thanks,
Kevin
fields.summary: Update documentation on changing the daily backup time

fields.description:
In the attached file copy the content of the page (near the bottom of the file next to heading {{content}} and paste it into a page in confluence. 
This content contains the \[long line of text\] . The brackets are not meant to be a link, however the page crashes (possibly because it believes it is a link) and throws
{code}
org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: (HibernateTemplate): encountered SQLException [Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESTSPACEKEY' at row 1]; nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESTSPACEKEY' at row 1
java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'DESTSPACEKEY' at row 1
{code}

This exception should be caught and a nice message displayed to the user explaining they have have used the \[\] brackets incorrectly.
